HDG.LOG.content: gathering properly begins w/ sheltering (Bergen her eigentlich anfangende Sammeln): the vintage (die Lese) is a selection (Auslese) > most important aspect [why?] to form the vintage is the sorting (Erlesen), the fore-gathering (Vor-lese) which determines (fügt) the selection, bringing together in gathering
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: gathering properly begins w/ sheltering (Bergen her eigentlich anfangende Sammeln): the vintage (die Lese) is a selection (Auslese) > most important aspect [why?] to form the vintage is the sorting (Erlesen), the fore-gathering (Vor-lese) which determines (fügt) the selection, bringing together in gathering

HDG.LOG.content: having-seen & having-heard not mere grasping (Erfassen), a certain kind of behavior (Verhalten) > this abiding (hält) as devoting to what lies-before, dispatching toward [both devote & dispatch forms of schicken], such behavior is appropriate (schickliches) thus skillful (geschickt), sophon thus is fateful (geschicklich)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: having-seen & having-heard not mere grasping (Erfassen), a certain kind of behavior (Verhalten) > this abiding (hält) as devoting to what lies-before, dispatching toward [both devote & dispatch forms of schicken], such behavior is appropriate (schickliches) thus skillful (geschickt), sophon thus is fateful (geschicklich)

HDG.IM.content: “Being” as universal, most comprehensive, nothing above and beyond “Being”: the more indeterminate/empty its content
HDG.IM.linkedContent: “Being” as universal, most comprehensive, nothing above and beyond “Being”: the more indeterminate/empty its content

HDG.IM.content: [Heidegger on Marx] spirit as intelligence becomes powerless superstructure to something else, counts as authentic because spirit-less > Marxism in its most extreme form understands spirit as intelligence [?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: [Heidegger on Marx] spirit as intelligence becomes powerless superstructure to something else, counts as authentic because spirit-less > Marxism in its most extreme form understands spirit as intelligence [?]

HDG.BC.content: via Nietzsche, soldier and worker determine the actual [MOP], unique fusion: “type of humanity taken as measure by the present world-convulsion (Welterschütterung) [epoch] for its fulfillment (Vollzug),” metaphysical titles that name form of human fulfillment of being of beings now manifest, presciently called “will to power” [but it is not epochal for Nietzsche] [Heidegger on the sly]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: via Nietzsche, soldier and worker determine the actual [MOP], unique fusion: “type of humanity taken as measure by the present world-convulsion (Welterschütterung) [epoch] for its fulfillment (Vollzug),” metaphysical titles that name form of human fulfillment of being of beings now manifest, presciently called “will to power” [but it is not epochal for Nietzsche] [Heidegger on the sly]

HDG.BC.content: “culture only exists insofar as it is plugged into (eingeschaltet) the operations that secure a basis for a form of domination” [what about Being’s security?] > [Heidegger congratulates himself on use of term from machine technology/utilization, like an automatic proof of actuality that finds words here] [method]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: “culture only exists insofar as it is plugged into (eingeschaltet) the operations that secure a basis for a form of domination” [what about Being’s security?] > [Heidegger congratulates himself on use of term from machine technology/utilization, like an automatic proof of actuality that finds words here] [method]

HDG.TB.content: saying of Appropriation in form of a lecture remains itself an obstacle of this kind [metaphysical obstacles that render such saying inadequate] > lecture has spoke merely in propositional statements
HDG.TB.linkedContent: saying of Appropriation in form of a lecture remains itself an obstacle of this kind [metaphysical obstacles that render such saying inadequate] > lecture has spoke merely in propositional statements

HDG.BT.content: [destruction not deconstruction] taking question of Being as our clue, we are to destroy traditional content of ancient ontology, until we arrive at primordial experiences [utterly impossible for Derrida] that achieved 1st ways of determining nature of Being (the ways that have guided us ever since [our destiny])
HDG.BT.linkedContent: [destruction not deconstruction] taking question of Being as our clue, we are to destroy traditional content of ancient ontology, until we arrive at primordial experiences [utterly impossible for Derrida] that achieved 1st ways of determining nature of Being (the ways that have guided us ever since [our destiny])

HDG.WM.content: list of more burdensome forms of nothing than negation: unyielding antagonism, stinging rebuke, galling failure, merciless prohibition, bitter privation
HDG.WM.linkedContent: list of more burdensome forms of nothing than negation: unyielding antagonism, stinging rebuke, galling failure, merciless prohibition, bitter privation

HDG.QB.content: Heidegger confesses: “I myself was not focused enough to articulate w/ sufficient clarity the reasons for my suggestion” [re: why he encouraged Jünger to reissue The Worker in original form] > now the time may have become more ready to say something [only may, not there yet]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: Heidegger confesses: “I myself was not focused enough to articulate w/ sufficient clarity the reasons for my suggestion” [re: why he encouraged Jünger to reissue The Worker in original form] > now the time may have become more ready to say something [only may, not there yet]

HDG.QB.content: “attempt to cross the line” captivated in form of representation (in ein Vorstellen gebannt) belonging to dominion (Herrschaftsbereich) of oblivion of Being > subject to doubts, like every image > but these doubts (Zweifeln) can’t touch illuminative force of images, their originary/uncircumventable presence (ursprüngliche und unumgehbare Gegenwart)—shows how little experience we have in the saying of thinking (der Sage des Denkens), in essence of such saying
HDG.QB.linkedContent: “attempt to cross the line” captivated in form of representation (in ein Vorstellen gebannt) belonging to dominion (Herrschaftsbereich) of oblivion of Being > subject to doubts, like every image > but these doubts (Zweifeln) can’t touch illuminative force of images, their originary/uncircumventable presence (ursprüngliche und unumgehbare Gegenwart)—shows how little experience we have in the saying of thinking (der Sage des Denkens), in essence of such saying

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger recognizes an accusation that he derived “being” from “is,” developed his philosophy form this “abstraction” > no, can only say “is” in openness of Being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger recognizes an accusation that he derived “being” from “is,” developed his philosophy form this “abstraction” > no, can only say “is” in openness of Being

HDG.FS.content: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through
HDG.FS.linkedContent: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through

HDG.FS.content: when attention is drawn to the presencing (das Anwesen) of “letting-be,” this interpretation that of metaphysics [doesn’t Heidegger interpret as such in Anaximander?] > in emphasis (Betonung) on presencing, a 3rd has its place (Ort), the stress (Ton) now on letting itself, that which allows (lässt) (releases [entlässt]?) presencing, allows Being, the epochē of Being: one stands before being as being, not a form (Gestalten) of its destiny [so close to Hegel] > in emphasis to let presencing, no longer room for name Being, letting is pure giving, the it (das Es) that gives, Ereignis [beyond Being]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when attention is drawn to the presencing (das Anwesen) of “letting-be,” this interpretation that of metaphysics [doesn’t Heidegger interpret as such in Anaximander?] > in emphasis (Betonung) on presencing, a 3rd has its place (Ort), the stress (Ton) now on letting itself, that which allows (lässt) (releases [entlässt]?) presencing, allows Being, the epochē of Being: one stands before being as being, not a form (Gestalten) of its destiny [so close to Hegel] > in emphasis to let presencing, no longer room for name Being, letting is pure giving, the it (das Es) that gives, Ereignis [beyond Being]

HDG.FS.content: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)

HDG.FS.content: Husserl attempts to articulate what Kant simply characterizes as concept of form: thus the given (Gegebenen) of intuition, categorial intuition, category more than a form > categorial as given
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Husserl attempts to articulate what Kant simply characterizes as concept of form: thus the given (Gegebenen) of intuition, categorial intuition, category more than a form > categorial as given

HDG.FS.content: for Husserl, the categorial, the forms, the “is” can be encountered (whereas, for Kant, they’re just deduced from table of judgment), the fact (Tatsache) of the category can be encountered (vorfinden)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Husserl, the categorial, the forms, the “is” can be encountered (whereas, for Kant, they’re just deduced from table of judgment), the fact (Tatsache) of the category can be encountered (vorfinden)

HDG.FS.content: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]

HDG.FS.content: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself
HDG.FS.linkedContent: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself

HDG.MA.content: releasement (Gelassenheit) toward things & openness to mystery (Geheimnis) belong together: give vision of new autochtony which might recapture autochtony in changed form
HDG.MA.linkedContent: releasement (Gelassenheit) toward things & openness to mystery (Geheimnis) belong together: give vision of new autochtony which might recapture autochtony in changed form

HDG.LP.content: the wanderers who follow strangers [now strangers themselves], now split (geschieden) from “loved ones,” to the strangers they are “others”: “the cast of the decomposed form of man (der Schlag der verwesten Gestalt des Menschen)”
HDG.LP.linkedContent: the wanderers who follow strangers [now strangers themselves], now split (geschieden) from “loved ones,” to the strangers they are “others”: “the cast of the decomposed form of man (der Schlag der verwesten Gestalt des Menschen)”

HDG.LP.content: Geschlecht (kin, kind, generation): a human cast away (verschlagene) from Menschenwesen, stamped (geprägte) in one cast (einem Schlag) > Geschlecht: both mankind as a whole and kinship of race, tribe, family, all of these stamped in the duality of the sexes (Zwiefache der Geschlechter), decomposed form of man, man unsettled (entsetzte) > a curse (Fluch) has struck man [cf. Derrida on Geschlecht, 2nd blow of sexes] > not duality (Zwiefache) but discord (Zwietracht) is the curse
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Geschlecht (kin, kind, generation): a human cast away (verschlagene) from Menschenwesen, stamped (geprägte) in one cast (einem Schlag) > Geschlecht: both mankind as a whole and kinship of race, tribe, family, all of these stamped in the duality of the sexes (Zwiefache der Geschlechter), decomposed form of man, man unsettled (entsetzte) > a curse (Fluch) has struck man [cf. Derrida on Geschlecht, 2nd blow of sexes] > not duality (Zwiefache) but discord (Zwietracht) is the curse

HDG.WL.content: is Saying the stream of stillness that forms (bildet)/joins (verbindet) its own two banks (Ufer): the Saying and our saying after it (unser Nachsagen)? [in forming joins: contra Derrida]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: is Saying the stream of stillness that forms (bildet)/joins (verbindet) its own two banks (Ufer): the Saying and our saying after it (unser Nachsagen)? [in forming joins: contra Derrida]

HDG.WL.content: [Heidegger speaks of losing possibility of grasping essence of language when we use dialectical tricks, when we try to form a notion of language] we should enter idiomatically into way-making of language (in die Be-wëgung sich eigens enlassend) [?]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: [Heidegger speaks of losing possibility of grasping essence of language when we use dialectical tricks, when we try to form a notion of language] we should enter idiomatically into way-making of language (in die Be-wëgung sich eigens enlassend) [?]

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt: inner illumination could impart such a different form to language, it would become totally other (ganz anderen) and new [presence worthy of the name?], an old shell (Gehäuse) w/ a new meaning
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Humboldt: inner illumination could impart such a different form to language, it would become totally other (ganz anderen) and new [presence worthy of the name?], an old shell (Gehäuse) w/ a new meaning

HDG.EC.content: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil
HDG.EC.linkedContent: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil

HDG.EC.content: abandonment of life as abandonment of Being, no longer allows for any beings > or, is a historical age where “life” in some form holds sway (herrscht), “the age of devastation”? [biopolitics?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: abandonment of life as abandonment of Being, no longer allows for any beings > or, is a historical age where “life” in some form holds sway (herrscht), “the age of devastation”? [biopolitics?]

HDG.EC.content: nationality: pure subjectivity of a people, relies on its “Nature” as what’s actual (Wirkliche), and all effecting (Wirken) comes from and goes back to this “Nature” > in subjectivity, man asserts himself as ground/measure of what’s actual > thus emerges (entspringt) the uprising (Aufstand) into work as form of achievement through which devastation of earth becomes unconditional [in German one more sentence than in English: Das einzige Gesetz der Verwüstung ist, dass das Nötige das Nötigste und das allein Nötige sei] > business of devastation: work for sake of increased possibility of work [Marxish?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: nationality: pure subjectivity of a people, relies on its “Nature” as what’s actual (Wirkliche), and all effecting (Wirken) comes from and goes back to this “Nature” > in subjectivity, man asserts himself as ground/measure of what’s actual > thus emerges (entspringt) the uprising (Aufstand) into work as form of achievement through which devastation of earth becomes unconditional [in German one more sentence than in English: Das einzige Gesetz der Verwüstung ist, dass das Nötige das Nötigste und das allein Nötige sei] > business of devastation: work for sake of increased possibility of work [Marxish?]

HDG.OHF.content: [Heidegger on modern forms of ontology vis phenomenology] only through phenomenology that ontology corresponding to it established on secure basis (sichere Problembasis): only in this manner that the consciousness-of-, the “of which (Wovon),” the object character of a being (der Gegenstandscharakter des Seienden) as such, becomes visible (sichtbar) > wide sense of phenomenology includes ontology > but, in such ontology, meaning of being (Seinssinn) never posed, unknown to it, genesis of meaning remains closed off to it > which field of Being is never asked
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Heidegger on modern forms of ontology vis phenomenology] only through phenomenology that ontology corresponding to it established on secure basis (sichere Problembasis): only in this manner that the consciousness-of-, the “of which (Wovon),” the object character of a being (der Gegenstandscharakter des Seienden) as such, becomes visible (sichtbar) > wide sense of phenomenology includes ontology > but, in such ontology, meaning of being (Seinssinn) never posed, unknown to it, genesis of meaning remains closed off to it > which field of Being is never asked

HDG.OHF.content: in its traditional categorial forms (Prägungen) [stamps], concept man fundamentally obstructs view to facticity
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: in its traditional categorial forms (Prägungen) [stamps], concept man fundamentally obstructs view to facticity

HDG.OHF.content: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]
